newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia regrets EU warnings on Belarus union.
newsitem.headline: Russia regrets EU warnings on Belarus union.

text.p: Russia expressed surprise and regret on Thursday at a threat by the European Parliament not to recognise a union treaty between Moscow and Belarus and dismissed it as political interference.

The European Parliament said in a resolution last Thursday it might block a planned trade and aid pact between the European Union and Belarus if Minsk did not undertake genuine political and economic reform.

"It looks as if this is a document typical of the times when political pressure and interference in the internal affairs of sovereign states was used in international relationships," a Russian foreign ministry statement said.
"The target and the tone of the resolution in particular cause our surprise and regret."
It said the European Parliament's resolution had fuelled tension in Belarus and harmed relations between Russia and the European Parliament.

The European Parliament accused Belarus' President Alexander Lukashenko of a "dictatorial style of government", including in his decision to form a union with Russia, and said this raised questions about EU relations with the former Soviet republics.
It said it would not recognise the union treaty, signed by Lukashenko and Russian President Boris Yeltsin in Moscow on April 2, until the Belarus parliament was consulted.
The union treaty outlines moves towards integration but has little immediate effect in practice.
The Russian foreign ministry said the creation of the union assumed a development of democratic principles in both states and was an expression of the will of the people in Belarus and Russia.
